h3. The JIRA installation documentation has an empty heading for SSL command line instructions in versions 6.0 - 6.4.  This has been corrected for the [latest version of the document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-commandline]. 

h3. Environment
* [For JIRA 6.4.0| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS]
* [For JIRA 6.0.0| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA060/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS]

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43790].
  {panel}

Many security-minded companies like to configure the default users in the "user" project role such that administrators are not members.

If these administrators create a project, they get redirected to the "browse project" page ... which they are not allowed to see :(

We should not send users to dead ends.
Perhaps we should detect this and redirect to project admin page?

Otherwise, have a different permission violation message for admins than normal users.
We don't need to pretend "it may have been deleted".
Admins can always admin the project (and even give themselves permissions to browse) so the page is simply annoying.
Perhaps something like "You do not have permission to browse this project. Click here to go to the administration page."
fields.summary: Post project create screen can send admin to a dead end

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43786].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When deleting users, feature settings for the user is not deleted. 

This can be reproduced as follows:
# Create a user
# Set a dark feature setting for that user (e.g. com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation.Disabled, by disabling the new Project Navigation from the User Profile)
# Delete the user
# Run the following SQL against the database
{code}select * from feature where user_key=deletedusername{code}
You'll see that the setting remains.

Additionally, when a user is recreated, the settings are all automatically re-applied, which may not be desirable in some use-cases.

h3. Suggested Solution
Delete all settings associated with a user when the user is deleted, so that all users would be in a default state when created (or re-created) until they begin to change settings.
fields.summary: Feature settings for users are not removed when users are deleted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43781].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
# JIRA is linked to Confluence using 2-Legged OAuth
# A JIRA issue is linked to a Confluence page
# A non-Confluence JIRA user (has a JIRA account but not a Confluence account) is not able to view the Confluence page title while viewing the JIRA issue
#* If User Impersonation is not used, the user will see:
!2_legged.png|thumbnail!
#* If User Impersonation is used, the user will see:
!impersonation.png|thumbnail!
(/) these are *expected*
# A JIRA user who is also a Confluence user but does not have the permission to view the Confluence page will see:
!500_error.png|thumbnail!
(!) this is not expected, as the user should also see that he doesn't have the permission to view that page, rather than the page can't be loaded, which is misleading
(i) similarly, the browser should return a 403 error instead of 500
+JIRA Log:+
{code}
2015-06-08 18:58:51,976 http-bio-2768-exec-8 ERROR andy 1138x3274x1 1t5y8q9 192.168.1.100,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/viewIssue/1/remoteIssueLink/render/10100 [viewissue.issuelink.rest.RemoteIssueLinkResource] Error occurred while generating final HTML for remote issue link: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Failed to load Confluence Page from remote server Caused by: java.io.IOException: Failed to load Confluence Page from remote server Caused by: com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Status Code: 200, Status Text: OK, Errors: {}, Error Messages: [java.lang.Exception: com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.RemoteException: You're not allowed to view that page, or it does not exist.]
{code}

h4. +Suggestion+
JIRA should be able to detect whether the Confluence page does not exist, or the user who is viewing the JIRA issue doesn't have the permission to view that Confluence page:
# if Confluence page does not exist (or JIRA can't connect to Confluence to determine that), it's fine to display "Failed to load" and throw 500 error
# if the user does not have the permission to view it, JIRA should display "You do not have permission to view this page" and throw 403 error
fields.summary: Improve Warning Messages when JIRA User is Not Allowed to view Confluence Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43779].
  {panel}

h1.Missing native packages for atlassian products.
    * We see that jira, stash, bamboo, confluence, crowd are upgraded very frequently.
        ** This is good in many ways.
        ** When there is no real unattended upgrade, it leads to a lots of cost.
    * The cost of upgrading the atlassian-stack, is roughly the same as we pay in licenses. We start to wonder if the atlassian stack was a mistake because of the extra hidden cost of the product.
    * For Atlassian it should be a one or two engineers to fix this problem for all the customers.
    * Similarly for each of your customers, it is 10% of one engineer pr company.
    * Given that you probably have approx 40,000 customers, this means that instead of spending 2 engineers (one for RHEL/CentOS/Fedora?) and one for Ubuntu/Debian, we - your customers spend 10% * 40,000 ≃ 4,000 engineers on updating the atlassian stack.

Please include yum-repos for your products!
fields.summary: Lack of update repository leads to double cost of the atlassian products.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43770].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
When using the Linux installer for JIRA, the bundled [JIRA Configuration Tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool] does not start, unless you have a local Java installation properly configured on your system. This is problematic, as the Linux installer does bundle Java, but {{config.sh}} never picks up those variables.

h4. Symptoms
You will notice the following error on the console:
{noformat}
No JRE_HOME or JAVA_HOME environment variable is set - attempting to just run java command{noformat}

In addition, the configuration tool is not launched.

(i) *Note:* If you have a working {{java}} command, the tool may still launch while seeing the above warning.

h4. Workaround
h5. Install Java
The best solution is to [install Java for JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+Java], preferably the latest from the [supported platforms page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] of your JIRA version.

This is recommended anyways, as generally new Java versions bring security and performance improvements.

h5. Use the bundled Java
You can invoke {{setenv.sh}} from the same {{bin}} directory where {{config.sh}} can be found. This should set the bundled Java's environment variables. Best is to invoke {{setenv.sh}} in {{config.sh}}.
fields.summary: No JRE_HOME or JAVA_HOME in linux server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43752].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Using [JIRA for Assets Management|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2015/03/free-ebook-jira-service-desks-guide-asset-management/] requires users to enter several issues at once. 

Albeit JIRA allows users to use the "create another" feature to log issues one after another, that is tiresome when entering many issues, specially as you have to wait for the form to be submitted to fill another issue.

And creating CSV files requires you to create a separate file, which becomes more and more complicate, and requires users to manage things in excel and then export to CSV and import into JIRA, which duplicates the information the user needs to store (once in Excel and then in JIRA).

\\

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if JIRA provided a "Bulk Create" feature, which would allow the user to select the project / issue type in which the issue would be created.

Then, select what fields would be available to enter (similarly to how the Create Issue screen works with the *Configure Fields*). 

The user could then simply use tab to go through all fields of the issue. Once it hits the end of the row, it would add a new line with empty fields for a new issue - similarly to how adding rows to a Confluence Table works. After filing the "rows" of the "table", the user can just submit the form once, which would create all needed issues.
fields.summary: As a JIRA User, I'd like to create multiple issues at once

fields.description:
I've got a big problem with JIRA working togehter with Stash on the server.

*Database*: MySQL
*System*: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS 64-Bit with Apache
*JIRA path*: /opt/jira
*JIRA home path*: /var/jira-home
*Stash path*: /opt/stash
*Stash home path*: /var/stash-home

I installed the standalone version from JIRA on the server with this manual: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Installing+JIRA+Standalone+on+Unix+or+Linux] I installed Stash on the same way. It seems that JIRA and Stash uses each his own Tomcat.

JIRA is working correct, as long as Stash is not running. If I start Stash with the startup.sh (or start-stash.sh) Stash is working, but the Tomcat of JIRA crashes without an error message. The catalina.out has no information about the crash. If I stop the tomcat of Stash and start JIRA again, JIRA is working correctly. 

So it's only possible to use one of them. I hope anyone can help with this problem.
fields.summary: JIRA is crashing together with Stash

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43726].
  {panel}

In addition I already found this issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-20505 but this was only for JIRA and the regarding footer. 

*Background*
In general the full stack of Atlassian products is providing many meta information to anonymous users. That does not only affects the footer which can be adjusted manually for each product (See end-user-agreement, 6.4 Attribution) but also the information within html headers.

Providing those information even to anonymous users on any login mask could be abused to identify security flaw. So if we just remove the version out of the footer, the page it self still contains any needed information, e.g.:
{code}<meta name="application-name" content="JIRA" data-name="jira" data-version="6.4.1">{code}
Also all manuell changes are not fully prove for upcoming update and increase therefore the impact of maintenance. In short: Editing templates is just _quick and dirty_ and could not be the best practice.

I suggest to give end users (in administration role) the opportunity hide all internal information for not logged in users. Such a system should only provide the login mask and in addition to the EUA 6.4 the "powered by Atlassian" term.

*Benefit and Business value*
Each product become more secure and more resistant to potential attacks. In my opinion this is helpful for all of your business customer who needs there Atlassian stack or single product online.
fields.summary: JIRA provides many information to anonymous users
Add Transition Issue Permission to all users who have Close Issues Permission, during or after an upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43724].
  {panel}

Recently, we have had a few users(mainly those updating from JIRA 5.X to 6.X) complaining that they cannot close issues.

We requested that they run permission helper to ensure they had all necessary permissions which always showed they did.

When we requested that they send us their permission scheme, we realized they did not have permission to transition issues and deducing that since when you close an issue the issue has to change state from the current state it was in to closed state, we tested this and confirmed that they needed this permission.

We would appreciate if relationships between permissions are emphasized in the documentation so customers are aware of them.
fields.summary: Update Documentation Emphasizing the Need to have Transition Permission to Close Issues

h4. +Scenario+
In certain situations, the first attempt to shut down Tomcat using:
* shutdown.sh _or_
* stop-jira.sh _or_
* catalina.sh stop

fails. A second attempt usually succeeds afterwards though.

h4. +Suggestion+
There's a KB that suggests several scripts to force a Tomcat shutdown if first attempt fails:
* [JIRA Does Not Terminate after Shutdown Script|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/the-jira-application-doesn-t-terminate-after-shutdown-script-is-executed-222200632.html]

It would be convenient if one of these scripts is integrated into the built-in shutdown scripts to reduce human efforts when such a case happens.
fields.summary: Improve built-in shutdown scripts to force a Tomcat shutdown if first attempt fails

  {panel}

h3. Allow More Exporting Options in JIRA Release Notes 
The only options in the user interface are HTML and Text, which can be very limiting.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow other exporting functions or integration functionality with third party applications.

h3. Workaround 
Copy the HTML/text and paste it into a compatible application, which is a very manual approach.
fields.summary: Allow More Exporting Options in JIRA Release Notes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43690].
  {panel}

At [Defininga Project - Creatingaproject|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Project#DefiningaProject-Creatingaproject] document, the difference between the following two bullets should be more clear: 

* Project Management: This project type creates the default JIRA project.
* JIRA Default Schemes: This is the only project type that creates a project (the default JIRA project) using the shared JIRA default schemes.

Since this templates use different workflows (after JIRA 6.4). The Project Management does not create a copy of the JIRA Default Schemes, as a reader could understand by reading the documentation.
fields.summary: The difference between Project Management characteristics should be clarified
Rename JIRA Classic to JIRA Default Schemes in documentation

h3. Problem Definition
By design in JIRA, we can turn on Time Tracking feature and then user can start logging work on all type of issues.

h3. Suggested Solution
When there is subtask created under issues, the accumulated work logged might not be accurate because then user can log work on subtask and the parent task as well. It will be good if there is an option to disable work log to the parent issue when there is subtask created.
fields.summary: Allow option to disable Work Log on Parent Issue when they an Issue have Subtask

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43668].
  {panel}

In JIRA 6.4 when using the new Project Navigator you are not able view the original versions, fixforversion, report.

Scenario (JIRA 6.4.3) with Project Navigator DISABLED:
# Log In
# Click Projects
# Click View All Projects
# Click the Project Name
# Click Versions
# Click Version
# Release, Summary, and Issue are now available

Scenario (JIRA 6.4.3) with Project Navigator ENABLED:
# Log In
# Click Projects
# Click View All Projects
# Click the Project Name
# If the project has defined versions You will see Releases (boat icon) in left nav
# Click Releases
# Click Version
# No further reports are available
fields.summary: Bring back the original Issue (FixForVersion) report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43664].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA by default seems to use the OS's default encoding for the 'file.encoding' property. As mentioned on [Internationalisation and Encoding Troubleshooting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Internationalisation+and+Encoding+Troubleshooting], JIRA should always use utf-8 for encoding. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the "-Dfile.encoding=utf-8" property by default to the JIRA Startup options.
fields.summary: Configure "-Dfile.encoding=utf-8" by default
Ability to change Favorite Filters colours

As an Admin I'd like to populate work log lie below:

"If user filled on 01/06/2015 that he worked on an issue 2 weeks and 3 days you will see in JIRA reports that he worked 104 hours on 01/06/2015"

It would be good to have another option while populating the work time: When users insert a time which is more then 24h, JIRA automatically would distribute the hours along the week, converting in days.

Rodrigo Silva | Cloud Support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43648].
  {panel}

When releasing a JIRA version, I would like to be able to specify which revision of the source code should be used. The feature is present in Bamboo[1], but not exposed in Jira.

My use case is simply that we tag our releases in git, and I would like to specify this tag (same as I can with the customized build feature in Bamboo) to be the revision to build the release from.

See attached image for the dialog as it currently exist. A field could be added here where it could be possible to specify revision.

There are also some questions on Atlassian Answers asking for this feature or similar[2][3]

[1]: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-1640
[2]: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/11161/specifying-the-source-code-revision-to-build
[3]: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/15696940/jira-build-release-needs-a-field-revision
fields.summary: Specify source revision to build release from

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43637].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a filter and change permissions so everyone can see it
# Switch to details view
# Copy the URL from the address bar (should be something like this https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/GROW-1333?filter=84971)
# Paste it to a friend or colleague
# They'll open it up and go directly to the view issue page for GROW-1333, instead of seeing your filter in issue navigator. There is however, the search context on the top right corner, but not highly visible and intuitive..

Expected Result:
The friend or colleague always sees the details view of the issue filter, rather than the view issue page.

Notes

You need to open the link in new browser session to repro this succesfully
fields.summary: Copying a filter URL with an issue selected causes the other person to see the issue, not the filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43634].
  {panel}

We often have huge discussion in our issue topics and if theres one comment I dont wish to read as I already know the information, I "fold" that comment so it takes no real space on the screen.
What JIRA should do is, that it saves the state of that comment to my logged in user so when a User re-enters the Issue the comments stays "hidden" (as in "folded") for that user.
That way, he (the user) doesnt have to fold the comment again.

That info (comment X of issue Y for user Z) should be saved in a database so the user can login wherever he want and it stays the same experience. Alternative a cookie could be set regarding this (or make use of the HTML5 storage?)
fields.summary: Ability to remember folded comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43633].
  {panel}

This issue doesnt seem to be new, but heres a few ideas how this can be implemented:

- When an project admin archives a comment the comment will get "greyed out" and/or "folded" so a future reader can read that comment but it isnt necessary (as it contains invalid info or is off-topic or <add another reason here>

We have some comments in our JIRA which tends to go off-topic sometime and we dont want the comments to "interact" with our future selfs.
Or if we have comments which contains invalid information - which could be deleted but its better to simply "shut if off" by archiving the comment.
fields.summary: Ability to archive comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43620].
  {panel}

h3.Summary

When the resolution of the computer is set to 1366 x 766; clicking on the comment button expands the comment section but it also hides the blue navigation bar at the top of the screen.

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Set the resolution of the desktop to 1366x766.
# Go to the issue navigator. Enable *Detail View*.
# Click on one of the issues; the details of the issue will be shown on the right side.
# Click on the comment button.

h3.Expected Result
The blue navigation bar at the top should remain intact.

h3.Current Result
The blue navigation bar vanishes.

h3.Workaround
No workaround besides refreshing the page or setting another desktop resolution.
fields.summary: UI bug at 1366 x 766 resolution in Issue Navigator

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43601].
  {panel}

JIRA recently added a "permanent" vertical scrollbar to all pages.

When a Modal Dialog is opened, the page is blanketed and the scrollbar is removed.  When the dialog is dismissed, the scrollbar does not return.

The scrollbar should always be present on pages, even after dialogs are opened and closed.

Reserving the space for the scrollbar or keeping the scrollbar around while a modal is open is out of scope of this bug.
fields.summary: JIRA+AUI Dialog and other modals need to honor the scrollbar styles

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43592].
  {panel}

As an admin, it would be great if we can configure the users which can/cannot view issue links. This can be done based on groups, or maybe have a permission just for that. A use case scenario would be like the following
# We have 2 Jira instances that have application links
# Jira A is accessible externally the company (customers)
# Jira B is accessible only internally
# There is an issue link between JIRA A & B
# Customers do not have access to JIRAB, so there is not point they can view issue links
fields.summary: Feature to hide issue links based on groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43590].
  {panel}

h4. +Context+
This ticket is created based on JRA-42515, after investigations have been conducted to verify the described behavior. Findings of the investigations:
# (/) *Writing user/group data from JIRA to LDAP is supposed to work properly* provided:
## The LDAP permission type configured in JIRA is Read/Write
## The username used for LDAP configuration has Read/Write privileges to LDAP
# (x) If 1.1 is correct, but 1.2 fails i.e. username without Read/Write privileges, then an unclear/misleading error message might be thrown, making it hard for JIRA admin to troubleshoot the root cause:
{code}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.GroupNotFoundException: Group <Unable to create group jira-users in directory 10000 in order to add membership of user user@domain.com (group jira-users found in directory 10000)> does not exist
{code}
# (!) This misleading message sounds like the Read/Write permission type of the LDAP directory does not work: unable to add an internal group to the LDAP server in order to add an LDAP user to it.
# (i) The *root cause*: the username used for LDAP configuration does not have Read/Write privileges to LDAP

h4. +Steps to reproduce & Facts+
# connect JIRA to an LDAP server using Connector type with Read/Write permission type
# specify a username without Read/Write privileges
# from User Management -> Users, try adding an LDAP user to an Internal group:
!user_browser.png|thumbnail!
## (!) When adding an LDAP user to an LDAP group, there's no error message, just a quick refresh in the browser, and the user is NOT added to the group.
# from User Management -> Groups, try adding an LDAP user to an Internal group:
!group_browser.png|thumbnail!
# from User Management -> Groups, try adding an LDAP user to an LDAP group:
!ldap_group_group_browser.png|thumbnail!
(/) The error message thrown at this step is *correct*

h4. +Suggestion+
{panel}
# The error message in step 3 and 4 above should be similar to that in step 5, which is correct, relevant, and meaningful.
# Also, the same message should be thrown for step 3.1.
{panel}
fields.summary: Improve Error Message when LDAP Write Fails due to Lack of User Privileges
Make Mentions use the IssueEvent pattern

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43585].
  {panel}

*Problem-Context*

Some of my customers are highly concerned about securing JIRA/Confluence. While accesing the tools can be easily secured through SSL a security painpont are the notfication mails. Enabling TLS for the mail server is useless in most scenarios as this only secures the transport to the next hop. 

So how to deal with it. The first strategy is to customize the mail templates and strip all content that is not allowed to be deliverd through insecure networks. There are some tickets in JIRA and confluence about this matter. However customizing the templates is to much administration as this needs to check after each update/upgrade of the tool. In addition the users really love the notifications, and stripping all content is not of much help to them.

The second strategy applies to a scenario where mails to some domains could be delivered without any concern (e.g. secure internal domain) and some mails to external suppliers needs to be dropped or filtered. In this case I recommend my customers to setup an postfix after queue filter to do the trick - which works pretty well.

*Suggestion*

There should be a flag in the notification scheme which says "Send mails to the user only if he or she has provided a valid mail certificate". In the user profile there would be an upload feature, so that the user can upload or update his public mail certificate (as selfservice - so no additional administration efforts in caretaking of certificates). And of course if the flag is set, the mail sent would be encrypted and signed by JIRA/Confluence and if the user has not stored a certificate he gets nothing (or an advice to store a mail certificate in his profile).
fields.summary: Enabling encrypted mail notifications
